result.execSummary:
The defendant Ulyesses J Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered from CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued. Pay supervision fees.
- No contact with firearms. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Complete Batterer's Intervention program.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No Contact with victim unless approved by the court. Defendant may have 3rd party contact for time with the child/ren.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ulyesses J Turner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ulyesses J Turner in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
.
Sentencing proceeded....
.
As to count 2:
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 80 days in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 16 months with the following conditions:
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court. Defendant may have 3rd party contact for time with the child/ren.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

As to count 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 1 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
